questions.prompt: King Dhritarastra cannot see the battlefield himself. What does he ask Sanjaya to tell him about?
choices: What the soldiers are eating for meals
What his own sons are doing at the battle
Why the horses are tired and resting
What day it is on the calendar
questions.feedback: The king wants to know what his own sons are doing now that they have gathered.

questions.prompt: Why is King Dhritarastra described as blind in Srila Prabhupada's explanation?
choices: Only because his eyes cannot see physical things around him
Because he cannot see with his eyes or understand spiritual truth
Because he is very old and weak in his body
Only because he needs Sanjaya to help him always
questions.feedback: Dhritarastra is blind in two ways - his eyes cannot see, and his love for his sons prevents him from seeing what is spiritually right. Sometimes loving someone too much can make us forget what is good and bad.

questions.prompt: When soldiers blow conchshells loudly, what are they trying to do?
choices: Play music for fun and entertainment
Make announcements and show they are ready
Scare animals away from the battlefield
Call people to eat their meals
questions.feedback: Blowing the conchshells is a signal that the soldiers are ready and united for the battle.

questions.prompt: Srila Prabhupada explains that Krsna's conchshell and the Pandavas' conchshells have special names. What does this tell us?
choices: These are just regular items that someone named much later
Only rich people can have named possessions and special items
Even Krsna's conchshell is eternal and special in the spiritual world
Names are just made up for fun in the stories
questions.feedback: Just like Krsna is eternal and never born, His conchshell and other items are also eternal and special. This shows that in the spiritual world, things are real and lasting, not like temporary things in our material world that break and disappear.

questions.prompt: Why does Arjuna ask his friend Krsna to stop the chariot in the middle of the battle?
choices: To get a drink of water from his water pot
So he can see and recognize all the people who came
To take a nap and rest briefly on the chariot
To play a game with his warrior friends nearby
questions.feedback: Arjuna wants to see who all is there because he knows these people and cares about them.

questions.prompt: When Arjuna sees his friends and family in the other army, how does he feel?
choices: Very happy and excited about the battle
Angry and ready to fight against them
Sad and confused about what to do
Confident and ready to lead them to victory
questions.feedback: Arjuna feels very sad because he doesn't want to hurt people he loves and knows.

questions.prompt: According to Srila Prabhupada, why is Arjuna's sadness about his relatives a problem?
choices: Because sadness is always wrong in all situations and should never happen
Because he thinks his relatives are only bodies and forgets their eternal souls
Because warriors should never care about anyone according to spiritual teaching
Because feeling sad makes you completely weak forever according to spiritual teaching
questions.feedback: Arjuna's pity comes from thinking his relatives are just their bodies. But everyone is really an eternal soul inside a body. When we only think of bodies and forget souls, we get confused about what is truly right.

questions.prompt: What happens to Arjuna's body when he is very sad and confused?
choices: It becomes very strong and powerful for battle
It feels shaky and he cannot stand up straight
It feels hot and sweaty all over
He feels energized and ready to fight
questions.feedback: When Arjuna is very upset, his body starts shaking and he has trouble standing because his mind is so troubled.

questions.prompt: Srila Prabhupada explains that Arjuna sees bad signs around him. What is really happening?
choices: Real ghosts and demons are appearing everywhere on the field at all
His confused and attached mind makes him see bad signs
The gods are truly angry and sending warnings to him
Nothing at all is happening and he is just lying
questions.feedback: When Arjuna becomes attached to his relatives' bodies, his mind gets confused and sees bad signs everywhere. The real problem is his confused thinking, not actual bad omens. Our attachment to people and things can cloud our mind.

questions.prompt: What does Arjuna think about fighting his own family members?
choices: It will make him a great hero in the world
It is good and he will be happy afterwards
It is wrong and he will gain nothing good from it
It will give him wealth and power to rule the kingdom
questions.feedback: Arjuna believes there is no good result from fighting people who are his own blood relatives.

questions.prompt: Srila Prabhupada explains that Arjuna talks about giving up the kingdom. What is the problem with Arjuna's thinking?
choices: He truly wants to give up everything and serve Krsna purely with complete devotion
He sounds like he is giving up, but is really just attached to relatives' bodies
He is completely correct and should immediately leave the battle and go away now
He has achieved perfect spiritual understanding already and knows everything completely now
questions.feedback: Arjuna sounds spiritual when he says he will give up the kingdom, but he is really just attached to his family's bodies. True giving up means doing your duty without attachment, not running away because you are too attached to people.

questions.prompt: When families are broken and lose their good ways, what happens to the people?
choices: They become richer and happier in every way
They become wiser and stronger in character
Bad things happen and good values are lost
They enjoy more freedom without old restrictions
questions.feedback: When families break apart and stop following good traditions, the people suffer and lose important values.

questions.prompt: What happens to the ancestors of a family that forgets its traditions?
choices: They become happy in the spiritual world
They receive honor and respect from everyone
They lose the honor of being remembered properly
Nothing changes and they remain the same
questions.feedback: When families stop doing proper ceremonies and remembering their ancestors, the ancestors lose the respect and care they deserve.

questions.prompt: Why do people sometimes do bad things just to get power and wealth?
choices: Because they are very wise and understand everything perfectly about life
Because they want to help others according to spiritual teaching always
Because their strong desire for things makes them forget what is right
Because they are forced to do it according to spiritual teaching rules
questions.feedback: When people really want power, money, or other things, they sometimes forget about right and wrong, and that causes harm.

questions.prompt: At the end of Chapter 1, what is Arjuna's condition?
choices: He is excited and ready to fight with all his great strength
He stands with his weapons ready to begin the battle courageously
He is so sad and confused that he sits down and cannot continue
He prepares to accept his fate courageously without any fear whatsoever
questions.feedback: Arjuna is so upset and sad that he puts down his weapons and sits down in the chariot, unable to do anything.
